13  package net.sf.oval.test.guard;
14  
15  import junit.framework.TestCase;
16  import net.sf.oval.ConstraintViolation;
17  import net.sf.oval.constraint.Length;
18  import net.sf.oval.constraint.NotNull;
19  import net.sf.oval.context.ConstructorParameterContext;
20  import net.sf.oval.exception.ConstraintsViolatedException;
21  import net.sf.oval.guard.Guard;
22  
23  /**
24   * @author Sebastian Thomschke
25   */
26  public class GuardingWithoutGuardedAnnotationTest extends TestCase
27  {
28  	public static class TestEntity
29  	{
30  		@SuppressWarnings("unused")
31  		@NotNull(message = "NOT_NULL")
32  		private String name = "";
33  
34  		/**
35  		 * Constructor 1
36  		 * 
37  		 * @param name
38  		 */
39  		public TestEntity(@NotNull(message = "NOT_NULL")
40  		final String name)
41  		{
42  			this.name = name;
43  		}
44  
45  		/**
46  		 * Constructor 2
47  		 * 
48  		 * @param name
49  		 * @param bla
50  		 */
51  		public TestEntity(final String name, final int bla)
52  		{
53  			this.name = name;
54  		}
55  
56  		public void setName(@NotNull(message = "NOT_NULL")
57  		@Length(max = 4, message = "LENGTH")
58  		final String name)
59  		{
60  			this.name = name;
61  		}
62  	}
63  
64  	public void testConstructorParameterConstraints()
65  	{
66  		final Guard guard = new Guard();
67  		guard.setInvariantsEnabled(TestEntity.class, true);
68  		GuardingWithoutGuardedAnnotationAspect.aspectOf().setGuard(guard);
69  
70  		/*
71  		 * Testing Constructor 1
72  		 */
73  		try
74  		{
75  			new TestEntity(null);
76  			fail();
77  		}
78  		catch (final ConstraintsViolatedException e)
79  		{
80  			final ConstraintViolation[] violations = e.getConstraintViolations();
81  			assertNotNull(violations);
82  			assertEquals(1, violations.length);
83  			assertTrue(violations[0].getMessage().equals("NOT_NULL"));
84  			assertTrue(violations[0].getContext() instanceof ConstructorParameterContext);
85  		}
86  
87  		new TestEntity("test");
88  
89  		/*
90  		 * Testing Constructor 2
91  		 */
92  		try
93  		{
94  			new TestEntity(null, 100);
95  			fail(); // invariant check on name fails
96  		}
97  		catch (final ConstraintsViolatedException ex)
98  		{
99  			// expected
100 		}
101 	}
102 
103 	public void testMethodParameterConstraints()
104 	{
105 		final Guard guard = new Guard();
106 		guard.setInvariantsEnabled(TestEntity.class, true);
107 		GuardingWithoutGuardedAnnotationAspect.aspectOf().setGuard(guard);
108 
109 		try
110 		{
111 			final TestEntity t1 = new TestEntity("");
112 			t1.setName(null);
113 			fail();
114 		}
115 		catch (final ConstraintsViolatedException e)
116 		{
117 			final ConstraintViolation[] violations = e.getConstraintViolations();
118 			assertNotNull(violations);
119 			assertTrue(violations.length > 0);
120 			assertTrue(violations[0].getMessage().equals("NOT_NULL"));
121 		}
122 
123 		try
124 		{
125 			final TestEntity t1 = new TestEntity("");
126 			t1.setName("12345678");
127 			fail();
128 		}
129 		catch (final ConstraintsViolatedException e)
130 		{
131 			final ConstraintViolation[] violations = e.getConstraintViolations();
132 			assertNotNull(violations);
133 			assertTrue(violations.length > 0);
134 			assertTrue(violations[0].getMessage().equals("LENGTH"));
135 		}
136 	}
137 }
